title: Manchester United pay tribute to Cristiano Ronaldo as Real superstar poses with FIFA Best award and Sir Alex Ferguson
text:

It may be eight years in the summer since Cristiano Ronaldo left Manchester United - but his bond with the Red Devils is seemingly just as strong as ever. 
The Portuguese capped an incredible 2016 by being crowned The Best FIFA Men's Player on Monday evening. 
Ronaldo beat Clasico rival Lionel Messi and Atletico Madrid striker Antoine Griezmann to the award, to add to his Ballon d'Or. 
And old club United were among the first to offer their congratulations to the player who departed for Real Madrid in 2009. 
"Well played, Cristiano!" they tweeted as FIFA confirmed the Los Blancos forward had won the gong. Ronaldo and Sir Alex have a chat (Photo: Getty) 
United were not the 31-year-old's only former club to pass on their best wishes, as Sporting Lisbon also sent out a tweet complete with a snap of a very youthful looking Ronaldo playing in their colours. 
They posted: "Congratulations, @Cristiano! #MadeInSporting #TheBest." 
Former Chelsea midfielder Michael Ballack also passed on his congratulations, including an image of the German in his Blues days alongside Ronaldo in a Manchester United tie. 
Ronaldo posed for a picture with former Old Trafford boss Sir Alex Ferguson backstage after winning the award. 
The pair have retained a strong relationship since Ronaldo's departure from United, often respectfully talking about one another in public. Ronaldo collects his award (Photo: Alexander Hassenstein - FIFA) 
Winning the prize caps a memorable 2016 for Ronaldo, a year which he says has been the best of his life. 
He won the Champions League with Real Madrid and Euro 2016 with Portugal. 
"Wow. It’s incredible," he said. It’s not the first time but this award is the first time. 
"I want first to thank my team-mates, my coach. I want to thank my family, my whole staff. 
"I tell you, 2016 was the best year of my career. I had a lot of doubts but the trophy showed that I lived up to that. 
"After I won what I did, I had no doubts. 
"It was a year that was magnificent on a personal level, on a sports level. I would like to thank very warmly everybody who voted for me. To the fans, to the other players, to the media: thank you." 
Ronaldo himself took to Twitter after receiving the award, commenting: "Delighted to win The Best FIFA award. Wouldn't be possible without my teammates, coaches and you who support me every day. Thanks everyone!" 
The Portuguese superstar was part of a Real Madrid contingent at the awards which included Sergio Ramos, Toni Kroos, Luka Modric and Marcelo, all of who were included in the FIFPro World XI of the Year. 
Boss Zinedine Zidane was also present, but the Frenchman missed out on Coach of the Year to Leicester manager Claudio Ranieri. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
